pr_title: IGNITE-13796 docs: update docs and examples for kubernetes module

timeline.message: IGNITE-13796 docs: update docs and examples for kubernetes module
Add docs to java thin client page

timeline.bodyText: @Nikita-tech-writer, please check the comments in the source code files too. I see some spellings below.
timeline.author: dmagda
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@
+/*
+ * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
+ * contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with
+ * this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership.
+ * The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0
+ * (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with
+ * the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package org.apache.ignite.examples.client;
+
+import org.apache.ignite.Ignition;
+import org.apache.ignite.client.ClientCache;
+import org.apache.ignite.client.IgniteClient;
+import org.apache.ignite.client.ThinClientKubernetesAddressFinder;
+import org.apache.ignite.configuration.ClientConfiguration;
+import org.apache.ignite.examples.model.Address;
+import org.apache.ignite.kubernetes.configuration.KubernetesConnectionConfiguration;
+
+/**
+ * Demonstrates how to use Ignite thin client within the Kubernetes cluster using KubernetesConnectionConfiguration.

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/examples/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/examples/client/ClientKubernetesPutGetExample.java b/examples/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/examples/client/ClientKubernetesPutGetExample.java index 5cb2104d6f..b775176002 100644 --- a/examples/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/examples/client/ClientKubernetesPutGetExample.java +++ b/examples/src/main/java/org/apache/ignite/examples/client/ClientKubernetesPutGetExample.java @@ -30,7 +30,7 @@ import org.apache.ignite.kubernetes.configuration.KubernetesConnectionConfigurat *

* Prerequisites: *

    - *
  • Running Ignite Kubernetes cluster. Check modules/kubernetes/DEVNOTES.md for example how to run a cluster locally.
    • + *
  • Running Ignite Kubernetes cluster. Check modules/kubernetes/DEVNOTES.md as an example of how to run a cluster locally.
    • *
  • A thin client application should be run within the cluster to have access to Ignite nodes pods.
    • *
  • KubernetesConnectionConfiguration must be in sync with the Ignite nodes configuration.
    • *

timeline.author: Nikita-tech-writer

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change *
  • A thin client application should be run within the cluster to have access to Ignite nodes pods.
    • *
  • A thin client application should be run within the cluster to provide access to the Ignite nodes pods.
timeline.author: Nikita-tech-writer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@ +/* + * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more + * contributor license agreements. See the NOTICE file distributed with + * this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership. + * The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0 + * (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with + * the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ + +package org.apache.ignite.examples.client; + +import org.apache.ignite.Ignition; +import org.apache.ignite.client.ClientCache; +import org.apache.ignite.client.IgniteClient; +import org.apache.ignite.client.ThinClientKubernetesAddressFinder; +import org.apache.ignite.configuration.ClientConfiguration; +import org.apache.ignite.examples.model.Address; +import org.apache.ignite.kubernetes.configuration.KubernetesConnectionConfiguration; + +/** + * Demonstrates how to use Ignite thin client within the Kubernetes cluster using KubernetesConnectionConfiguration. + *

+ * Prerequisites: + *

    + *
  • Running Ignite Kubernetes cluster. Check modules/kubernetes/DEVNOTES.md for example how to run a cluster locally.
    • + *
  • A thin client application should be run within the cluster to have access to Ignite nodes pods.

replies.bodyText: Thin client does not "provide" access to Ignite, but do "have" the access to it within the cluster. I mean that there is no access to cluster if thin client isn't running within the cluster.
replies.author: timoninmaxim

replies.bodyText: OK, got it, thanks for the explanation!
replies.author: Nikita-tech-writer
